summary: The “Putting Veterans First Act of 2025” aims to protect veterans and military families. It addresses employee protections within the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), including limitations on hiring freezes, office closures, and changes to telework. It mandates reporting on personnel, research, and financial effects tied to government efficiency initiatives. The bill also includes provisions for mental health, employment assistance, and enhanced information access. It covers contract review and reporting requirements, including those regarding wait times for community care and response times to congressional inquiries, as well as several other measures that benefit veteran and military communities.
